pullRequest.title: [PaxosStateLog] Splitting log
pullRequest.bodyText:
Goals (and why):
Implement log that delegates reads and writes based on a cutoff sequence
Implementation Description (bullets):
As discussed, mark if we see reads and writes at old sequences, otherwise delegate everything to new log.
Testing (What was existing testing like?  What have you done to improve it?):
Trivial
Concerns (what feedback would you like?):
Do we want something else?
Where should we start reviewing?:
tiny
Priority (whenever / two weeks / yesterday):
This week

nodes.bodyText: Seems like we should truncate both? Or just throw UnsupportedOperationException given where we're deploying this

We should talk about this one: I think it needs careful thought. The acceptors for example are just going to fail the legacy requests with a TruncatedStateLogException (see PaxosAcceptor.checkLogIfNeeded()) which might affect our visibility into them

commit.message: Noop truncate and remember least log entry

nodes.bodyText:
This does incur a read whenever creating this object.
This is constructed once per (client, use-case). Let's go ahead with this for now I think
Discussed offline: This is ok as long as we make sure internal server doesn't say that it is fully ready until this has completed for all clients.
We can also hack in an optimisation to make getLeastLogEntry() faster at a majority of installations.
log.warn("Tried to truncate with an impl that doesn't support it") or something like that please, this may confuse unsuspecting users.

commit.message: Merge branch 'develop' of github.com:palantir/atlasdb into psl/splitting-log
Merge branch 'develop' of github.com:palantir/atlasdb into psl/splitting-log
Make discussed changes and add unit tests

nodes.bodyText: nit: We could probably just use mock-maker-inline
